content: Productivity is not about doing more, but about creating more impact with less work. Key techniques include timeboxing, the Pomodoro Technique, and the Eisenhower Matrix for prioritizing tasks.

The Pomodoro Technique uses a timer to break work into intervals, traditionally 25 minutes in length, separated by short breaks. Each interval is known as a pomodoro. This improves focus and prevents burnout.
For better sleep hygiene, it is recommended to avoid screens at least one hour before bed, maintain a consistent sleep schedule, and ensure the bedroom is dark, quiet, and cool.

A good daily wrap-up includes reflecting on what was accomplished, identifying what went well, and planning the top 1-3 priorities for the next day. This creates closure and sets up for future success.
